section.title: Setting the JBOSS_HOME Environment Variable
section.para: The Mobicents Platform (Mobicents) is built on top of the JBoss Application Server (JBoss AS). The JBOSS_HOME environment variable does not need to be set to run any of the Mobicents Platform servers unless JBOSS_HOME is already set.

section.para: The Mobicents Platform, and its individual servers, are built on top of the JBoss Application Server (JBoss AS). When the Mobicents Platform or servers are built from source, JBOSS_HOME must be set.

Mobicents files are installed onto a clean JBoss AS installation. The build process assumes that the location referenced in the JBOSS_HOME environment variable is the JBoss AS installation into which the Mobicents files must be installed.
Building the servers from source is outside the scope of this user guide, however it is useful to understand the role played by JBoss AS and JBOSS_HOME in the Mobicents ecosystem.

important.para: Always check JBOSS_HOME to verify if the environment variable is correctly defined for the system on which the server is installed. Potential troubleshooting may be avoided by performing this check.

section.bridgehead: JBOSS_HOME does not need to be specified for the following binary packages:

listitem.para: Mobicents Server binary distribution that include the JBoss AS.

section.bridgehead: JBOSS_HOME must be specified for the following conditions:

listitem.para: When installing the Mobicents Platform or any of the Mobicents servers from source.
When installing any binary that does not bundle JBoss AS.

section.para: For information regarding installing the JBoss AS, refer to the JBoss AS Installation Guide.

formalpara.title: Setting the JBOSS_HOME Environment Variable on Linux
formalpara.para: The JBOSS_HOME environment variable must point to the directory which contains all of the files for the installed Mobicents Platform or individual Mobicents server. In the following procedure, install_directory_path refers to the server directory that contains a /bin subdirectory.

section.para: Setting JBOSS_HOME in the ~/.bashrc startup script sets the environment variable for the current user each time the server starts. It is possible to set JBOSS_HOME as a system-wide environment variable, by specifying it in /etc/bashrc, but this method is not recommended.
